title: Letter from Richard D. Gibb to Eugene C. Logue
creator: Gibb, Dr. Richard D.
description: Letter from President Gibb to Eugene C. Logue explaining and clarifying the Foundation's actions regarding South African divestiture. Gibb states that the Foundation has not voted to divest, but has instead asked "companies who do business in South Africa to subscribe to the Sullivan Principles."
subject: letter; Sullivan Principles
source: "President's Office (Gibb) records, 1977-1989", UG41, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, https://www.lib.uidaho.edu/special-collections/
